title: Chanel runway crasher calls Gigi Hadid 'rude'
text:
The French 'prankster' who crashed Chanel's runway at Paris Fashion Week this week has revealed that she initially planned to smoke a cigarette on the runway — but Gigi Hadid's swift action in escorting her out foiled her plan.

On Monday, 28-year-old Marie Benoliel, known as Marie S’Infiltre, made international headlines when jumped up onto the elevated Chanel runway and walked with a parade of models during the show's finale.

But speaking to the New York Times, Marie said her disruption would have been even more outrageous had Gigi, 24, not swooped in so quickly to remove her — a move she brazenly calls 'rude.'

Still interested? The French prankster who crashed Chanel's runway at Paris Fashion Week this week has revealed more details about the viral and controversial stunt

Puff! 28-year-old Marie Benoliel, known as Marie S’Infiltre, said she initially planned to smoke a cigarette on the runway — but Gigi Hadid's swift action in escorting her out foiled her plan

How dare she! Marie also called the supermodel 'rude' for escorting her out of a presentation where she didn't belong

In addition to seemingly holding a grudge against Gigi for preventing her on-stage puff, Marie also called the supermodel 'rude' for escorting her out of a presentation where she didn't belong.

'She was rude,' she said, seemingly without any sense of irony.

'Then, after, there were three models that wanted to fight. I didn’t understand why she was like this, so aggressive. Of course she doesn’t know me. I can understand that she wanted to protect her friends.'

She added, however, that she thinks she and Gigi could be friends now.

'I think it’s really funny and I love Gigi and I think now we can be close friends. She thought I was a crazy girl. But she’s right. She’s right actually,' she said.

Marie also defended her actions, saying that fashion should be 'joyful' and 'has to make people happy,' adding: 'I think nowadays fashion doesn’t make people happy. It makes people ridiculous and pretentious.'

The YouTuber also shared details of just how she managed to pull off the stunt, explaining that she borrowed a Chanel suit that her mother had purchased in 1986, ensuring she'd look the part.

Of Gigi, she said: I didn’t understand why she was like this, so aggressive. Of course she doesn’t know me. I can understand that she wanted to protect her friends'

'I think it’s really funny and I love Gigi and I think now we can be close friends. She thought I was a crazy girl. But she’s right. She’s right actually,' she added

'I look like a grandma with the suit but I don’t care, it’s Chanel,' she said. 'Bye bye, Lily Rose. Bye bye, Cara Delevingne. I’m here.'

She had no invitation for the event, and fashion shows — particularly big ones like Chanel — have tons of security with people ensuring that everyone who walks in is supposed to be there.

So she waited for it to get especially busy, getting turned away three times before finally making it in.

She has no qualms about sneaking around.

'I’m really used to lying. It’s part of my work,' she said. 'I hate people who say "you’re good, you’re bad." I don’t care about this.'

Speaking to Elle.com on Wednesday, Marie said that Gigi was 'quite aggressive' toward her, adding: 'She clearly did not understand my comic approach.'

She said she thought Gigi was going to pull her hair and yell at her 'as if we were school girls.'

The Youtuber added, though, that has no hard feelings about what happened.

'Prank': On the first day of PFW, she managed to get on the runway at the ETAM show, where she walked behind lingerie-clad Cindy Bruna wearing a silver sparkly bustier and shorts

History repeating: She cropped up on the runway at the Etam show on the first day of the week at the Roland Garros stadium, scantily dressed in a bra and hot-pants (left)

This is funny now? The YouTuber is clearly reveling in the attention she is getting

'Gigi is obviously sublime and a fashion icon and I understand her reaction somewhat and continue to love her in spite of that,' Benoliel said.

She went on to say that she has drawn inspiration from British satirist Sacha Baron Cohen and that she likes to 'immerse myself in public events or situations... to show how funny some situations and sometimes extreme behaviors are.'

She explained: 'I am not making fun of people, I am pointing how silly some people can be when they lack distance and thinking.'

Tuesday's incident marked the second time that Benoliel, who currently stars in a one-woman show at the Comédie des Champs Elysées theatre, crashed a fashion week event this week.

She popped up on the runway at the Etam show on the first day of the fashion week at the Roland Garros stadium, scantily dressed in a bra and hot-pants.
description: On Monday, 28-year-old Marie Benoliel, known as Marie S'Infiltre, ran up onto the runway at Chanel's show at Paris Fashion Week. She was soon grabbed and escorted out by Gigi, 24.
